params.assets: amount of assets to calculate fee on
params.id: vault id

returns._0: feeAmount amount of assets that would be used as atom deposit fraction NOTE: only applies to triple vaults

params.atomUris: atom data array to create atoms with

returns._0: ids vault ids array of the atoms NOTE: This function will revert if called with less than `getAtomCost()` * `atomUris.length` in `msg.value`

params.objectIds: vault ids array of object atoms NOTE: This function will revert if called with less than `getTripleCost()` * `array.length` in `msg.value`.       This function will revert if any of the atoms do not exist or if any ids are triple vaults.
params.predicateIds: vault ids array of predicate atoms
params.subjectIds: vault ids array of subject atoms

params.data: data of the operation to be cancelled

params.id: vault id of the atom associated to the atom wallet

returns._0: atomWallet the address of the atom wallet NOTE: the create2 salt is based off of the vault ID

params.id: vault id to get corresponding assets for
params.shares: amount of shares to calculate assets on

returns._0: assets amount of assets that would be exchanged by vault given amount of 'shares' provided

params.assets: amount of assets to calculate shares on
params.id: vault id to get corresponding shares for

returns._0: shares amount of shares that would be exchanged by vault given amount of 'assets' provided

params.atomUri: atom data to create atom with

returns._0: id vault id of the atom NOTE: This function will revert if called with less than `getAtomCost()` in `msg.value`

params.objectId: vault id of the object atom
params.predicateId: vault id of the predicate atom
params.subjectId: vault id of the subject atom

returns._0: id vault id of the triple NOTE: This function will revert if called with less than `getTripleCost()` in `msg.value`.       This function will revert if any of the atoms do not exist or if any ids are triple vaults.

params.id: vault id to get corresponding share price for

returns._0: price current share price for the given vault id
atomWallet the address of the atom wallet NOTE: deploys an ERC4337 account (atom wallet) through a BeaconProxy. Reverts if the atom vault does not exist

depositAtom(address,uint256).details: assets parameter is omitted in favor of msg.value, unlike in ERC4626

params.id: the vault ID of the atom
params.receiver: the address to receive the shares

returns._0: shares the amount of shares minted NOTE: this function will revert if the minimum deposit amount of eth is not met and       if the vault ID does not exist/is not an atom.

depositTriple(address,uint256).details: assets parameter is omitted in favor of msg.value, unlike in ERC4626

params.id: the vault ID of the triple
params.receiver: the address to receive the shares

returns._0: shares the amount of shares minted NOTE: this function will revert if the minimum deposit amount of eth is not met and       if the vault ID does not exist/is not a triple.

params.assets: amount of assets to calculate fee on
params.id: vault id to get corresponding fees for

returns._0: feeAmount amount of assets that would be charged for the entry fee NOTE: if the vault being deposited on has a vault total shares of 0, the entry fee is not applied

params.assets: amount of assets to calculate fee on
params.id: vault id to get corresponding fees for

returns._0: feeAmount amount of assets that would be charged for the exit fee NOTE: if the vault  being redeemed from given the shares to redeem results in a total shares after of 0,       the exit fee is not applied
atomCost the cost of creating an atom

params.id: vault id of the triple

returns._0: counterId the counter vault id from the given triple id NOTE: only applies to triple vault IDs as input

params.assets: amount of `assets` to calculate fees on
params.id: vault id to get corresponding fees for

returns._0: totalFees total fees that would be charged for depositing 'assets' into a vault

params.assets: amount of `assets` to calculate fees on (should always be msg.value - protocolFee)
params.id: vault id to get corresponding fees for

returns._0: totalAssetsDelta changes in vault's total assets
returns._1: sharesForReceiver changes in vault's total shares (shares owed to receiver)
returns._2: userAssetsAfterTotalFees amount of assets that goes towards minting shares for the receiver
returns._3: entryFee amount of assets that would be charged for the entry fee

params.id: vault id to get corresponding fees for
params.shares: amount of `shares` to calculate fees on

returns._0: totalUserAssets total amount of assets user would receive if redeeming 'shares', not including fees
returns._1: assetsForReceiver amount of assets that is redeemable by the receiver
returns._2: protocolFee amount of assets that would be sent to the protocol multisig
returns._3: exitFee amount of assets that would be charged for the exit fee

params.id: vault id of the triple/counter-triple

returns._0: tuple(atomIds) the atoms that make up the triple/counter-triple NOTE: only applies to triple vault IDs as input
tripleCost the cost of creating a triple
shares number of shares user has in the vault
returns._1: assets number of assets user has in the vault

params._defaultVaultFees: Default vault fees struct NOTE: This function is called only once (during contract deployment)

maxDeposit max amount of eth that can be deposited into the vault

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.assets: amount of assets to calculate shares on
params.id: vault id to get corresponding shares for

returns._0: shares amount of shares that would be minted from the deposit of `assets` NOTE: this function pessimistically estimates the amount of shares that would be minted from the       input amount of assets so if the vault is empty before the deposit the caller receives more       shares than returned by this function, reference internal _depositIntoVault logic for details

params.id: vault id to get corresponding assets for

returns._0: assets amount of assets estimated to be returned to the receiver

params.receiver: the address to receiver the assets
params.shares: the amount of shares to redeem

returns._0: assets the amount of assets/eth withdrawn NOTE: Emergency redemptions without any fees being charged are always possible, even if the contract is paused       See `getRedeemAssetsAndFees` for more details on the fees charged

params.id: the vault ID of the triple
params.receiver: the address to receiver the assets
params.shares: the amount of shares to redeem

scheduleOperation(bytes32,bytes).details: schedule an operation to be executed after a delay

setAtomDepositFractionForTriple(uint256).details: sets the atom deposit fraction percentage for atoms used in triples      (number to be divided by `generalConfig.feeDenominator`)

setAtomDepositFractionOnTripleCreation(u.details: sets the atom deposit fraction on triple creation used to increase the amount of assets      in the underlying atom vaults on triple creation

params.atomDepositFractionOnTripleCreation: new atom deposit fraction on triple creation

setAtomUriMaxLength(uint256).details: sets the atom URI max length

setAtomWalletInitialDepositAmount(uint25.details: sets the atom share lock fee

setEntryFee(uint256,uint256).details: sets entry fees for the specified vault (id=0 sets the default fees for all vaults)      id = 0 changes the default entry fee, id = n changes fees for vault n specificallyadmin cannot set the entry fee to be greater than `maxEntryFeePercentage`, which is      set to be the 10% of `generalConfig.feeDenominator` (which represents 100%), to avoid      being able to prevent users from depositing assets with unreasonable fees

params.id: vault id to set entry fee for

setExitFee(uint256,uint256).details: sets exit fees for the specified vault (id=0 sets the default fees for all vaults)      id = 0 changes the default exit fee, id = n changes fees for vault n specificallyadmin cannot set the exit fee to be greater than `maxExitFeePercentage`, which is      set to be the 10% of `generalConfig.feeDenominator` (which represents 100%), to avoid      being able to prevent users from withdrawing their assets

params.id: vault id to set exit fee for

setMinDeposit(uint256).details: sets the minimum deposit amount for atoms and triples

setMinShare(uint256).details: sets the minimum share amount for atoms and triples

setProtocolFee(uint256,uint256).details: sets protocol fees for the specified vault (id=0 sets the default fees for all vaults)      id = 0 changes the default protocol fee, id = n changes fees for vault n specificallyadmin cannot set the protocol fee to be greater than `maxProtocolFeePercentage`, which is      set to be the 10% of `generalConfig.feeDenominator` (which represents 100%), to avoid      being able to prevent users from depositing or withdrawing their assets with unreasonable fees

params.id: vault id to set protocol fee for

params.protocolMultisig: address of the new protocol multisig

setTripleCreationProtocolFee(uint256).details: sets fee charged in wei when creating a triple to protocol multisig

params.id: vault id of the triple

returns._0: hash the corresponding hash for the given RDF triple NOTE: only applies to triple vault IDs as input
hash the corresponding hash for the given RDF triple based on the atom vault ids

approvals(address,address).notice: Mapping of receiver to sender to determine if a sender is allowed to deposit assets on behalf of a receiver

approveSender(address).notice: approve a sender to deposit assets on behalf of the receiver

atomDepositFractionAmount(uint256,uint25.notice: returns atom deposit fraction given amount of 'assets' provided

batchCreateAtom(bytes[]).notice: Batch create atoms and return their vault ids

batchCreateTriple(uint256[],uint256[],ui.notice: batch create triples and return their vault ids

computeAtomWalletAddr(uint256).notice: returns the Atom Wallet address for the given atom data

convertToAssets(uint256,uint256).notice: returns amount of assets that would be exchanged by vault given amount of 'shares' provided

convertToShares(uint256,uint256).notice: returns amount of shares that would be exchanged by vault given amount of 'assets' provided

count().notice: ID of the last vault to be created

createAtom(bytes).notice: Create an atom and return its vault id

createTriple(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: create a triple and return its vault id

currentSharePrice(uint256).notice: returns the current share price for the given vault id

depositAtom(address,uint256).notice: deposit eth into an atom vault and grant ownership of 'shares' to 'reciever'         *payable msg.value amount of eth to deposit

depositTriple(address,uint256).notice: deposits assets of underlying tokens into a triple vault and grants ownership of 'shares' to 'receiver'         *payable msg.value amount of eth to deposit

entryFeeAmount(uint256,uint256).notice: returns amount of assets that would be charged for the entry fee given an amount of 'assets' provided

exitFeeAmount(uint256,uint256).notice: returns amount of assets that would be charged for the exit fee given an amount of 'assets' provided

getAtomCost().notice: returns the cost of creating an atom

getAtomWarden().notice: returns the address of the atom warden

getCounterIdFromTriple(uint256).notice: returns the counter id from the given triple id

getDepositFees(uint256,uint256).notice: returns the total fees that would be charged for depositing 'assets' into a vault

getDepositSharesAndFees(uint256,uint256).notice: returns the shares for recipient and other important values when depositing 'assets' into a vault

getRedeemAssetsAndFees(uint256,uint256).notice: returns the assets for receiver and other important values when redeeming 'shares' from a vault

getTripleAtoms(uint256).notice: returns the atoms that make up a triple/counter-triple

getTripleCost().notice: returns the cost of creating a triple

getVaultStateForUser(uint256,address).notice: returns the number of shares and assets (less fees) user has in the vault

isTripleId(uint256).notice: returns whether the supplied vault id is a triple

maxDeposit().notice: returns max amount of eth that can be deposited into the vault

maxRedeem(address,uint256).notice: returns max amount of shares that can be redeemed from the 'sender' balance through a redeem call

previewDeposit(uint256,uint256).notice: simulates the effects of the deposited amount of 'assets' and returns the estimated         amount of shares that would be minted from the deposit of `assets`

previewRedeem(uint256,uint256).notice: simulates the effects of the redemption of `shares` and returns the estimated         amount of assets estimated to be returned to the receiver of the redeem

protocolFeeAmount(uint256,uint256).notice: returns amount of assets that would be charged by a vault on protocol fee given amount of 'assets'         provided

redeemAtom(uint256,address,uint256).notice: redeem shares from an atom vault for assets

redeemTriple(uint256,address,uint256).notice: redeems 'shares' number of shares from the triple vault and send 'assets' eth         from the contract to 'reciever' factoring in exit fees

revokeSender(address).notice: revoke a sender's approval to deposit assets on behalf of the receiver

tripleHash(uint256).notice: returns the corresponding hash for the given RDF triple, given the triple vault id

tripleHashFromAtoms(uint256,uint256,uint.notice: returns the corresponding hash for the given RDF triple, given the atoms that make up the triple

vaultFees(uint256).notice: Mapping of vault ID to vault fees

vaults(uint256).notice: Mapping of vault ID to vault state
